question: What is the theme of the 2018 International Mother Language Day (IMLD)?
option1: Quality education, language(s) of instruction and learning outcomes
option2: Inclusion in and through education: Language counts
option3: Linguistic diversity and multilingualism count for sustainable development
option4: Towards Sustainable Futures through Multilingual Education
answer: Linguistic diversity and multilingualism count for sustainable development
explanation: The International Mother Language Day (IMLD) is celebrated every year by UNESCO on February 21 to promote awareness of linguistic and cultural diversityand promote multilingualism. This year, in 2018, UNESCO commemorates the 70th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and its bold statement that ‘no discrimination can be made on the basis of language’, and celebrates its translation into more than 500 languages. The 2018 theme is \"Linguistic diversity and multilingualism count for sustainable development\".
